page.title: 18Wildlife 1
page.content: In the west the woodland contained several habitats-fast flowing stream valleys,mixed woodland slopes & large deciduous trees with dense scrub beneath.This expanded the ecology of the area,particularly birds.Common breeds species such as various tits, woodpigeons,chaffinch & blackbirds are abundant.Other breeding birds are kingfishers,dipper,grey & pied wagtails & spotted flycatchers on the River Churn & heron,lapwing & swallows on the adjacent flood plain.In the woodland area are buzzards sparrowhawks all 3 woodpecker species redstarts tree pipit various warblers,cuckoo,goldcrest nuthatch & treecreepers.Ecologically the birds play a major part in food chains & food webs in the area,both consuming plants & insects or in the case of birds of prey eating other birds.
